title: Outside Parts Salesperson
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for an Outside Parts Salesperson. The Outside Parts Salesperson develops and achieves maximum profitable sales volume of parts and labor services from assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations to ascertain future parts, service and truck requirements.

  • Develops and achieves maximum sales volume consistent with realistic sales projections for assigned accounts focusing on parts and labor sales opportunities.
  • Oversees operations of assigned customers. Advises or assists them in such areas as inventory selection and control, service available, new products and services, etc.
  • Plans territory coverage. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Takes orders, introduces new products and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary.
  • Completes customer call sheets weekly, stating summary of calls made.
  • Controls personal expenses within the approved expense budget and submits weekly expense reports.
  • Promotes all MHC product and service offerings including RoadForce, Service, Body Shop, Truck Sales, Leasing, Carrier and Finance.
  • Investigates and refer customer complaints to the appropriate Department Manager and/or Branch Manager.
  • Assists, whenever necessary, the counter personnel with orders, deliveries, returns, inventory and other tasks as assigned.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.

title: Service Technician
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic. The role of the Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic performs heavy-duty mechanical repair under general supervision, receiving on the job training in a development program to achieve Service Journeyman status.

  • Performs and/or assists in the performance of general mechanical duties.
  • Gains experience by working on the following items with minimal supervision: engine overhaul, fuel systems, electrical systems, transmissions, cooling systems, chassis, brakes, engine tune-up, and general maintenance.
  • Works on major components with close supervision.
  • Performs trouble shooting on minor problems.
  • Attends training sessions and meetings.
  • Maintains a neat and orderly working area, and proper handling of company tools.
  • Advises the Shop Foreman if additional repair work is necessary.
  • Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary.

title: Branch Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck Dealership and Leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Branch Manager. The role of the Branch Manager is to be responsible for the day-to-day operation of the Branch’s operations in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls all activities of the branch profit centers through department managers who in turn are responsible for the overall growth and profit objectives of their respective department. Staffs and trains department managers as required. Formulate the major objectives, specific policies, plans, procedures, and programs for the branch operations; work closely with department managers to convert broad programs to specific plans; provide assistance to department managers in the development of their specific performance targets, programs and plan in accordance with Company goals and objectives; evaluate each department’s operating results and performance against pre-determined objectives; consult with department manager regarding personnel decisions; assist department managers with major, target or critical accounts.  

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the branch.
  • Establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for assigned branch, within the Company’s overall plans and policies.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied throughout assigned branch.
  • Formulates annual and monthly business plan, sales/profit objectives and expense budgets with department manager which are in accordance with Company’s objectives.
  • Develops merchandising strategies with the department managers to ensure that objectives are obtained; supervises sale of trucks, parts and service.
  • Ensures the branch is in compliance with local, state and federal governmental regulations.
  • Maintains appropriate communications within and between various departments and functional areas within the branch; holds individual conferences as required.
  • Establishes and maintains satisfactory customer and public relations; final arbitrator between customers and department managers when the need arises.
  • Develops and trains department managers and reviews and appraises their performance. Recommends compensation change in accordance with company policy. Ensures the organizational structure of the branch is efficiently planned and adequately and competently staffed.       
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.

SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.

title: Management Trainee- Denver. CO
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Management Trainee – Leasing. The Management Trainee – Leasing is to develop the skills and talents towards providing quality transportation solutions to our commercial customers and potential future leadership positions within MHC Truck Leasing. Training and skill development will be hands on focused in the rental and leasing areas. Coordinates rental activities in accordance with proper procedures for the branch with focus on sales support and driving new sales opportunities for all product lines. May assist in planning, organizing, directing, and controlling the efforts of the Rental Department in the accomplishment of the business plan objectives with the focus on becoming qualified to move into a Rental Manager’s position.

  • Prepare Sales Proposals for new and existing Rental customers. Leads may be generated by direct mailers, conducts in-person cold calls, as well as rental solicitation calls.
  • Manage location fleet and execute rental contracts to meet daily reservations. *Work closely with Service Department to ensure that customer communication is consistent.
  • Make weekly sales/telesales prospecting calls.
  • Ensures all Branch units have the required licenses, permits, and identification required to operate legally and timely resulting in no lost revenue.
  • Timely collect, audit, and prepare Driver Trip Records related to rental units in accordance with procedure.
  • Checks in and out rental trucks, conducts daily lot checks, and ensures the fleet is ready and presentable to potential customers.
  • Completes rental reports rental billing daily and when scheduled. Obtains current mileage and receives written approval when estimates are quoted.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.
SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position. Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.

title: Parts Sales Specialist
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Parts Sales Specialist. The Parts Sales Specialist is responsible for assisting all customers and technicians in securing needed parts and supplies. Will also be accountable for achieving the monthly sales and gross profit forecasts, and for seeking and soliciting parts sales.

  • Works with customers, outside salespersons and technicians to fill parts requirements with general supervision.
  • Prepares invoices for all over the counter sales and bills parts to repairs orders that are issued to the shops.
  • Assists in maintaining stock levels, receiving and shipping parts, and in issuing local purchase orders.
  • Maintains a favorable relationship with customers by addressing their needs and issues in a timely manner. Escalates customer issues to supervisor when needed.
  • Maintains a neat and clean appearance in the customer parts area and parts warehouse.
  • Enters all lost sales into the inventory system so that proper inventory items and levels can be maintained.
  • Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Ensures proper safety, care, and maintenance of company vehicles and equipment. Reports any damage to company equipment or property immediately to supervisor.
  • Assists with inventory management related activities as directed by supervisor.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.

title: Parts Sales Specialist
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Parts Sales Specialist. The Parts Sales Specialist is responsible for assisting all customers and technicians in securing needed parts and supplies. Will also be accountable for achieving the monthly sales and gross profit forecasts, and for seeking and soliciting parts sales.

  • Works with customers, outside salespersons and technicians to fill parts requirements with general supervision.
  • Prepares invoices for all over the counter sales and bills parts to repairs orders that are issued to the shops.
  • Assists in maintaining stock levels, receiving and shipping parts, and in issuing local purchase orders.
  • Maintains a favorable relationship with customers by addressing their needs and issues in a timely manner. Escalates customer issues to supervisor when needed.
  • Maintains a neat and clean appearance in the customer parts area and parts warehouse.
  • Enters all lost sales into the inventory system so that proper inventory items and levels can be maintained.
  • Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Ensures proper safety, care, and maintenance of company vehicles and equipment. Reports any damage to company equipment or property immediately to supervisor.
  • Assists with inventory management related activities as directed by supervisor.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

  • Creates and closes repair orders in the MHC business system to document the repair work performed and the time spent completing the repair. Completes paperwork as required to accurately document the work performed.
  • Controls business expenses within the approved expense budget and is responsible for tooling and parts inventory on the service truck.
  • Oversees operations of assigned customers in territory. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Introduces items such as preventive maintenance, new products, and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary.

title: Sr. Tax Accountant
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Senior Tax Accountant. The Senior Tax Accountant supports the Tax Director with the overall MHC income tax return processes and compliance. The Senior Tax Accountant also manages the Federal Excise Tax (FET) and other taxes at the local, state, and federal level for MHC.  This position is in office 5 days a week.

  • Manages the compliance related activities for MHC, including the schedules provided to company external tax advisors, quarterly tax estimates, state apportionments, annual tax returns, tax planning, accruals, and other projects related to the overall MHC tax process. 
  • Manages Federal Excise Tax (FET) payments, return preparation, and audits (as needed). Perform internal audit of all FET exempt transactions.  Implement and manage processes for compliance with FET requirements. 
  • Manage the research and implementation of available local, state, and Federal tax credits and incentives for existing, new, and remodeled MHC owned facilities. 
  • Supports all aspects of the sales and use tax process for MHC, including: the review of exemption certificates according to established tax laws, policies and procedures; proactively ensure that all exemption certificates are current by contacting customers as needed; preparation and payment of monthly sales tax returns; actively manage audits to minimize and eliminate tax liability; evaluate potential risk for the various company entities; and review all fixed asset invoices for proper use tax accrual. 
  • Supports real estate and personal property assessments, payments, and real estate appeals, in conjunction with the outside services firm. Evaluate potential risk for the various company entities.  
  • Supports the processing of payments, submitting returns (that require financial data), and managing accruals for all business licenses, franchise tax, vehicle inventory tax (VIT), battery tax, and KC earnings tax. 
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Service Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Service Manager. The role of the Service Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operation of the branch’s Service Department in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls the activities of the Service Department to ensure the overall growth and profit objectives are met. Formulates the major objectives, specific plans, plan procedures and programs for the Service Department; evaluates the department’s results and performance against objectives. Maintains the highest quality standards of professionalism in serving the customer and identifying their needs.

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the Service Department.
  • Within the Company’s overall plans and policies, establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for the Service Department.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied within the department.
  • Formulates annual and monthly sales/profit objectives and expense budget in accordance with company objectives.
  • Reviews and appraises the results of activities within the department and takes appropriate action as necessary.
  • Travels with outside sales force and own on to customer locations on a regular basis promoting Service Department and dealerships.
  • Works with Parts Manager and outside sales force in a proactive way to improve labor sales efforts of outside sales force.
  • Maintains appropriate communication within and between all departments within the branch.
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.
  • Develops and maintains policies and practices which will ensure positive employee and customer relations.
  • Is familiar with the activities of competition, market conditions and department operation; keeps the Branch Manager informed.
  • Coordinates the processing of warranty claims with Warranty Manager and administers warranty and policy adjustments in the most fair and honest manner for the customer, dealership and vendor.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by a supervisor.

title: Detail shop Tech
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck Dealership and Leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Body Shop Detailer. The role of the Body Shop Detailer will perform cleaning and detailing of vehicles, full appearance reconditioning inside and out, interior/exterior paint/fab application -wash, clean and polish vehicles, provide quality workmanship in a timely manner.

  • Washes vehicle exterior, cleans interior and exterior windows, and wipes down doorjambs.
  • Cleans upholstery, rugs, and other surfaces, using appropriate cleaning agents, applicators, and cleaning devices.
  • Cleans engine and engine compartment with steam-cleaning equipment and various cleaning agents.
  • Inspects vehicles for noticeable defects, such as dents, scratches, torn upholstery, and poor mechanical operation. Communicates all defects to supervisor.
  • Replaces missing or defective small parts.
  • Maintains a neat and orderly working area. Responsible for proper handling and prevention of damage to company tools, equipment, and facilities. Reports any damage to company or customer equipment or property immediately to supervisor.
  • Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Abides by all company policies.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Outside Parts Salesperson
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for an Outside Parts Salesperson. The Outside Parts Salesperson develops and achieves maximum profitable sales volume of parts and labor services from assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations to ascertain future parts, service and truck requirements.

  • Develops and achieves maximum sales volume consistent with realistic sales projections for assigned accounts focusing on parts and labor sales opportunities.
  • Oversees operations of assigned customers. Advises or assists them in such areas as inventory selection and control, service available, new products and services, etc.
  • Plans territory coverage. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Takes orders, introduces new products and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary.
  • Completes customer call sheets weekly, stating summary of calls made.
  • Controls personal expenses within the approved expense budget and submits weekly expense reports.
  • Promotes all MHC product and service offerings including RoadForce, Service, Body Shop, Truck Sales, Leasing, Carrier and Finance.
  • Investigates and refer customer complaints to the appropriate Department Manager and/or Branch Manager.
  • Assists, whenever necessary, the counter personnel with orders, deliveries, returns, inventory and other tasks as assigned.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Service Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Service Manager. The role of the Service Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operation of the branch’s Service Department in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls the activities of the Service Department to ensure the overall growth and profit objectives are met. Formulates the major objectives, specific plans, plan procedures and programs for the Service Department; evaluates the department’s results and performance against objectives. Maintains the highest quality standards of professionalism in serving the customer and identifying their needs.

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the Service Department.
  • Within the Company’s overall plans and policies, establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for the Service Department.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied within the department.
  • Formulates annual and monthly sales/profit objectives and expense budget in accordance with company objectives.
  • Reviews and appraises the results of activities within the department and takes appropriate action as necessary.
  • Travels with outside sales force and own on to customer locations on a regular basis promoting Service Department and dealerships.
  • Works with Parts Manager and outside sales force in a proactive way to improve labor sales efforts of outside sales force.
  • Maintains appropriate communication within and between all departments within the branch.
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.
  • Develops and maintains policies and practices which will ensure positive employee and customer relations.
  • Is familiar with the activities of competition, market conditions and department operation; keeps the Branch Manager informed.
  • Coordinates the processing of warranty claims with Warranty Manager and administers warranty and policy adjustments in the most fair and honest manner for the customer, dealership and vendor.

title: Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic. The role of the Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic is to perform heavy-duty mechanical truck repair and maintenance offsite at customer locations. Develops relationships with customers to achieve labor sales quota and increase sales to assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations for opportunities to increase service sales in the given territory.

  • Performs routine mechanical repairs and maintenance on heavy-duty truck equipment and related components with general supervision.
  • Coordinates customer repair orders with Service Manager and Shop Foremen for task assignment. Coordinates with Service Advisor for proper work scheduling of all mobile maintenance business.
  • Advises customer of needed service work, as well as suggests additional labor, parts and body shop sales whenever possible (i.e., Preventive Maintenance Inspections, related service work, etc.).
  • Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Ensures proper safety, care, and maintenance of company vehicles assigned to the technician. Reports any damage to company or customer equipment or property immediately to supervisor.
  • Maintains favorable relations with customers.
  • Creates and closes repair orders in the MHC business system to document the repair work performed and the time spent completing the repair. Completes paperwork as required to accurately document the work performed.
  • Controls business expenses within the approved expense budget and is responsible for tooling and parts inventory on the service truck.
  • Oversees operations of assigned customers in territory. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Introduces items such as preventive maintenance, new products, and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary.
  • Responsible for achieving labor sales objectives and quota for assigned accounts.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic. The role of the Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic is to perform heavy-duty mechanical truck repair and maintenance offsite at customer locations. Develops relationships with customers to achieve labor sales quota and increase sales to assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations for opportunities to increase service sales in the given territory.

  • Performs routine mechanical repairs and maintenance on heavy-duty truck equipment and related components with general supervision.
  • Coordinates customer repair orders with Service Manager and Shop Foremen for task assignment. Coordinates with Service Advisor for proper work scheduling of all mobile maintenance business.
  • Advises customer of needed service work, as well as suggests additional labor, parts and body shop sales whenever possible (i.e., Preventive Maintenance Inspections, related service work, etc.).
  • Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Ensures proper safety, care, and maintenance of company vehicles assigned to the technician. Reports any damage to company or customer equipment or property immediately to supervisor.
  • Maintains favorable relations with customers.
  • Creates and closes repair orders in the MHC business system to document the repair work performed and the time spent completing the repair. Completes paperwork as required to accurately document the work performed.
  • Controls business expenses within the approved expense budget and is responsible for tooling and parts inventory on the service truck.
  • Oversees operations of assigned customers in territory. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Introduces items such as preventive maintenance, new products, and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary.
  • Responsible for achieving labor sales objectives and quota for assigned accounts.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Service Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Service Manager. The role of the Service Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operation of the branch’s Service Department in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls the activities of the Service Department to ensure the overall growth and profit objectives are met. Formulates the major objectives, specific plans, plan procedures and programs for the Service Department; evaluates the department’s results and performance against objectives. Maintains the highest quality standards of professionalism in serving the customer and identifying their needs.

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the Service Department.
  • Within the Company’s overall plans and policies, establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for the Service Department.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied within the department.
  • Formulates annual and monthly sales/profit objectives and expense budget in accordance with company objectives.
  • Reviews and appraises the results of activities within the department and takes appropriate action as necessary.
  • Travels with outside sales force and own on to customer locations on a regular basis promoting Service Department and dealerships.
  • Works with Parts Manager and outside sales force in a proactive way to improve labor sales efforts of outside sales force.
  • Maintains appropriate communication within and between all departments within the branch.
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.
  • Develops and maintains policies and practices which will ensure positive employee and customer relations.
  • Is familiar with the activities of competition, market conditions and department operation; keeps the Branch Manager informed.
  • Coordinates the processing of warranty claims with Warranty Manager and administers warranty and policy adjustments in the most fair and honest manner for the customer, dealership and vendor.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by a supervisor.

SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.

title: Service Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Service Manager. The role of the Service Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operation of the branch’s Service Department in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls the activities of the Service Department to ensure the overall growth and profit objectives are met. Formulates the major objectives, specific plans, plan procedures and programs for the Service Department; evaluates the department’s results and performance against objectives. Maintains the highest quality standards of professionalism in serving the customer and identifying their needs.

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the Service Department.
  • Within the Company’s overall plans and policies, establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for the Service Department.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied within the department.
  • Formulates annual and monthly sales/profit objectives and expense budget in accordance with company objectives.
  • Reviews and appraises the results of activities within the department and takes appropriate action as necessary.
  • Travels with outside sales force and own on to customer locations on a regular basis promoting Service Department and dealerships.
  • Works with Parts Manager and outside sales force in a proactive way to improve labor sales efforts of outside sales force.
  • Maintains appropriate communication within and between all departments within the branch.
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.
  • Develops and maintains policies and practices which will ensure positive employee and customer relations.
  • Is familiar with the activities of competition, market conditions and department operation; keeps the Branch Manager informed.

title: Director of Human Resources
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Director of Human Resources. The Director of Human Resources operates as a strategic and tactical partner to business operations leadership by aligning the People strategy to the business strategy and incorporating into day-to-day work. The Director of Human Resources will manage day to day activities of the Human Resources team and provide guidance and support to mid-to-higher level leaders with the objective of adding value to the business. This is a full generalist role and as such this individual will perform a wide range of Human Resources activities including but not limited to employee relations management, talent development, compensation administration, workforce planning/talent acquisition, manager/executive development, organizational design and performance management. This position is fully on site in Leawood, KS.

  • Serve as primary Human Resources support and strategic business partner for various assigned business leaders in the MHC organization.
  • Provide progressive people solutions such as integrated talent management, workforce planning, succession planning, and organization structure to increase business impact.
  • Review and analyze workforce data and key people metrics to improve the worker experience, assess gaps and opportunities and provides insights to leaders to help inform the right business decisions.
  • Propose People solutions and/or organizational changes based upon an analysis of critical business opportunities.
  • Manage complex employee relations issues including organizational and structural changes, conduct and direct investigations ensuring proper handling, documentation and alignment with legal.
  • Serve as an advisor to management for employment related legal issues and ensures local compliance with federal, state, provincial, and local employment laws.
  • Work with management to develop and implement training strategies to meet employee needs. Collaborating with Learning & Development and/or selects consultants as necessary to provide programs and facilitation.
  • Continually challenge and improve the programs, policies, practices and processes associated with meeting the strategic and operational people issues of the organization.
  • Lead a regional team of Human Resources professionals to ensure consistent and streamlined practices and services across the business.
  • Support the ongoing development and career progression of Human Resources team members through coaching, performance feedback and career discussion to foster meaningful career experiences while meeting the needs of the business.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Outside Parts Salesperson
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for an Outside Parts Salesperson. The Outside Parts Salesperson develops and achieves maximum profitable sales volume of parts and labor services from assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations to ascertain future parts, service and truck requirements.

  • Develops and achieves maximum sales volume consistent with realistic sales projections for assigned accounts focusing on parts and labor sales opportunities.
  • Oversees operations of assigned customers. Advises or assists them in such areas as inventory selection and control, service available, new products and services, etc.
  • Plans territory coverage. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Takes orders, introduces new products and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary.
  • Completes customer call sheets weekly, stating summary of calls made.
  • Controls personal expenses within the approved expense budget and submits weekly expense reports.
  • Promotes all MHC product and service offerings including RoadForce, Service, Body Shop, Truck Sales, Leasing, Carrier and Finance.
  • Investigates and refer customer complaints to the appropriate Department Manager and/or Branch Manager.
  • Assists, whenever necessary, the counter personnel with orders, deliveries, returns, inventory and other tasks as assigned.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Credit Analyst
description_html:
MHC Financial Services, LLC represents MHC as their captive finance company facilitating the sale and delivery of Kenworth, Volvo, Hino, and Isuzu trucks. As MHCFS continues to grow, we have an opening for a Credit Analyst – Equipment Finance. The Credit Analyst – Equipment Finance approves credit transactions to obtain maximum profits and division sales within the guidelines established for the company. Protects company assets, provides the best possible service to MHC branch and divisional personnel. 

  • Responsible for the timely approval of credit within stated authority.
  • Responsible for the development and recommendation of credit criteria.
  • Assists in the preparation and review of loan and lease documents.
  • Responsible for the development and timely presentation of standard credit and fleet credit approvals to PACCAR Financial Corporation or other lenders, including financial statement analysis.
  • Maintains credit files to meet audit and PACCAR Financial standards.
  • Manages the Credit Department in the absence of the Credit Manager so that it meets the stated company goals for performance.
  • Develops and maintains a strong working relationship between the Credit Department and MHC divisions.
  • Follows-up on outstanding approvals for insight towards the customer’s purchasing decision.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

title: Branch Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck Dealership and Leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Branch Manager. The role of the Branch Manager is to be responsible for the day-to-day operation of the Branch’s operations in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls all activities of the branch profit centers through department managers who in turn are responsible for the overall growth and profit objectives of their respective department. Staffs and trains department managers as required. Formulate the major objectives, specific policies, plans, procedures, and programs for the branch operations; work closely with department managers to convert broad programs to specific plans; provide assistance to department managers in the development of their specific performance targets, programs and plan in accordance with Company goals and objectives; evaluate each department’s operating results and performance against pre-determined objectives; consult with department manager regarding personnel decisions; assist department managers with major, target or critical accounts.  

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the branch.
  • Establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for assigned branch, within the Company’s overall plans and policies.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied throughout assigned branch.
  • Formulates annual and monthly business plan, sales/profit objectives and expense budgets with department manager which are in accordance with Company’s objectives.
  • Develops merchandising strategies with the department managers to ensure that objectives are obtained; supervises sale of trucks, parts and service.
  • Ensures the branch is in compliance with local, state and federal governmental regulations.
  • Maintains appropriate communications within and between various departments and functional areas within the branch; holds individual conferences as required.
  • Establishes and maintains satisfactory customer and public relations; final arbitrator between customers and department managers when the need arises.
  • Develops and trains department managers and reviews and appraises their performance. Recommends compensation change in accordance with company policy. Ensures the organizational structure of the branch is efficiently planned and adequately and competently staffed.       
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.

SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.

title: Diesel Service Apprentice / Mechanic Intern
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Diesel Service Apprentice / Mechanic Intern. The role of the Diesel Service Apprentice / Mechanic Intern is a part time position while enrolled at technical school established to provide the employee on-the-job training and observe the intern’s technical competency, aptitude, and work attitude. During the internship, he/she will perform light maintenance and routine service until the necessary skills are demonstrated. Upon the satisfactory completion of the internship and school program, the intern will be progressed to the next appropriate level of responsibility.

  • Performs assigned job functions under close supervision of a Foreman, Leadman, Supervisor or designated competent fellow employee. 
  • Gains work related knowledge and experience through on-the-job training and formal off-site training at OSU-Okmulgee campus. 
  • Maintains a neat and orderly work area and properly handles company tools and equipment.

title: Branch Manager
description_html:
Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck Dealership and Leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Branch Manager. The role of the Branch Manager is to be responsible for the day-to-day operation of the Branch’s operations in compliance with established policies and procedures. Plans, directs and controls all activities of the branch profit centers through department managers who in turn are responsible for the overall growth and profit objectives of their respective department. Staffs and trains department managers as required. Formulate the major objectives, specific policies, plans, procedures, and programs for the branch operations; work closely with department managers to convert broad programs to specific plans; provide assistance to department managers in the development of their specific performance targets, programs and plan in accordance with Company goals and objectives; evaluate each department’s operating results and performance against pre-determined objectives; consult with department manager regarding personnel decisions; assist department managers with major, target or critical accounts.  

  • Assesses present and future needs, trends, problems and profit opportunities of the branch.
  • Establishes short and long-term operating and financial objectives for assigned branch, within the Company’s overall plans and policies.
  • Ensures that approved policies and objectives are clearly understood and effectively applied throughout assigned branch.
  • Formulates annual and monthly business plan, sales/profit objectives and expense budgets with department manager which are in accordance with Company’s objectives.
  • Develops merchandising strategies with the department managers to ensure that objectives are obtained; supervises sale of trucks, parts and service.
  • Ensures the branch is in compliance with local, state and federal governmental regulations.
  • Maintains appropriate communications within and between various departments and functional areas within the branch; holds individual conferences as required.
  • Establishes and maintains satisfactory customer and public relations; final arbitrator between customers and department managers when the need arises.
  • Develops and trains department managers and reviews and appraises their performance. Recommends compensation change in accordance with company policy. Ensures the organizational structure of the branch is efficiently planned and adequately and competently staffed.       
  • Promotes safe work habits and ensures that safety rules are followed.

SAFETY-SENSITIVE

This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties.
